alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued September 04 at 3:54AM MDT until September 05 at 3:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 3 AM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...West to southwest winds 30 to 40 MPH with gusts up to 65 MPH expected. Thunderstorms may produce locally stronger wind gusts. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills and the Laramie Valley, including Arlington, Elk Mountain, and Laramie. This includes Interstate 80 between Rawlins and Laramie. * WHEN...9 AM MDT this morning until 3 AM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight or high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Thunderstorms may produce wind gusts up to 75 MPH across the warned area late this morning through the early afternoon.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage.

area.areaDesc: Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills
